Key Match Events: The Memphis Grizzlies managed to defend the homecourt despite the Orlando Magic looking like the better offensive team.
The Grizzlies came up with a 124-111 victory over the Magic.
Santi Aldama had a solid 22-point outing.
Jay Huff, who scored 18 points matched with 60% shooting from long-distance and 77.8% overall.
Pre-Game Insights: Saturday's matchup marked the official return of Jaren Jackson Jr. to Memphis' lineup.
Post-Match Reflections: The Memphis Grizzlies will take on the Chicago Bulls on Monday. Hopefully, Morant and Jackson could find their rhythm by then.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Magic had four players in double-scoring figures, two of which scored 20 points and above.
Franz Wagner was the Magic’s top scorer after putting up 23, while Jalen Suggs scored 21 points.
Ja Morant and the Memphis Grizzlies faced the Orlando Magic on Saturday.
Others: Ja Morant had a cold start in the first quarter, scoring only three points and clearly struggled with his shot, sinking one out of four attempts.
Ja Morant had a much better second-quarter performance, adding seven points to his total score.
Morant’s struggle, the Memphis Grizzlies managed to keep their lead alive with a 90-78 third-quarter finish.
